DataElement.preferredName: Serum Albumin Measurement Diagnosis Timepoint Hematology Lab Albumin Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value related to the serum albumin measurement at the time of diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins._A quantitative measurement of albumin present in a sample._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The clear liquid part of the blood that remains after blood cells and clotting proteins have been removed.:A quantitative measurement of albumin present in a sample.

Concepts.definition: The clear portion of the blood that remains after the removal of the blood cells and the clotting proteins.
A quantitative measurement of albumin present in a sample.

Property.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
A specific point in the time continuum, including those established relative to an event.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a hematology laboratory value for albumin.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: family of globular proteins found in many plant and animal tissues that tend to bind a wide variety of ligands.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A family of globular proteins found in many plant and animal tissues that tend to bind a wide variety of ligands.  Albumin is the main protein in blood plasma.  Low serum levels occur in conditions associated with malnutrition, inflammation and liver and kidney diseases.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
